page.title: 19JOBS IN LONGBENTON (2)
page.content: Unemployment is a striking factor of life in 1985 and this is reflected in particular in Longbenton. These are the views of some of the children from St. Stephen's RC Primary School on their hopes for employment. Daniel (aged 9): "Working in Longbenton wouldn't interest me. I would like to be a designer, producing new engines. I would like to work in America." Joanne (aged 9): "I would not like to work in Longbenton because there aren't a lot of jobs in this area...I would like to join the army because you might get a chance to travel abroad. The prospects would be better." Kelly (aged 9): "I would love to work in Newcastle in a fashion shop like Top Shop. I think it would be interesting serving all the customers.
